text.section: The Center may secure bonds by a trust agreement.
The corporate trustee under a trust agreement may be a trust company or a bank that has the powers of a trust company in or outside the State.

In addition to the provisions described in § 10-840(h) of this subtitle, the trust agreement may contain:
either:
a provision conveying or mortgaging all or a portion of the project; or
a provision creating a collateral account;
other provisions that the Center considers reasonable and proper for the security of bondholders; and
a provision that restricts the individual right of action by bondholders.
An expense incurred in carrying out the trust agreement or a resolution may be treated as part of the cost of the operation of a project.
